responsibilities: Develop LLM-based reasoning techniques, including automated decision-making and context understanding.
Integrate LLM solutions into the core product to enhance user experiences and streamline compliance workflows.
Proficiency in chunking large documents and creating efficient indexes for retrieval-augmented generation.
Run queries on RAG databases or vector stores to retrieve relevant context.
Re-rank and optimize results to provide the highest-quality context for LLM queries.
Collaborate with the engineering team to integrate LLM solutions into infrastructure, ensuring compatibility and scalability.
Partner with product managers and engineers to align functionality with the product vision and deliver tangible user value.
Conduct code reviews, write clean, maintainable code, and follow software engineering best practices.
Continuously experiment with cutting-edge ML techniques and frameworks, particularly those related to LLMs and emerging technologies.
Monitor and evaluate LLM system performance in production, iterating on solutions and model selection to ensure high reliability.
skills: Expertise in LLM pipelines and RAG frameworks (e.g., Haystack, LlamaIndex, LangChain).
Strong programming skills in Python or similar languages.
Solid understanding of cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) for production deployment and performance monitoring.
Proficiency in Go, TypeScript, gRPC, and Protocol Buffers (Protobuf).
Hands-on experience with LLM model tuning and performance benchmarking.
Familiarity with NLP and ML techniques for text classification.
Knowledge of microservices architecture, DevOps, and containerization tools (Docker, Kubernetes).
analysis: The job responsibilities and skills clearly indicate a focus on working with Large Language Models (LLMs). The responsibilities include developing LLM-based reasoning techniques, integrating LLM solutions into products, and optimizing results for LLM queries. Additionally, there is a focus on experimenting with ML techniques related to LLMs and monitoring LLM system performance. The skills required include expertise in LLM pipelines and frameworks, hands-on experience with LLM model tuning, and familiarity with NLP and ML techniques. These elements strongly suggest that the job involves working with Generative AI and language models.
